intro: Seseli turbith, commonly known as Turbith seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves that are often divided into narrow, lance-shaped segments. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of Central and Eastern Europe, including parts of Turkey and the Balkans. Seseli turbith is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides.
